open.title: How do I engage or request something from a public sector org?
open.body:
As a developer working in the public sector, how do I engage with a public sector org to request something?  For example, I'd love to request from BC Gov to share their .www2.gov.bc.ca LESS/CSS stylesheets so I can write apps for BC Government without having to reverse engineer [www2.gov.bc.ca](www2.gov.bc.ca).  

Similar to:

[https://wet-boew.github.io/v4.0-ci/index-en.html](https://wet-boew.github.io/v4.0-ci/index-en.html)

open.title: Embed intro video into roadmap
open.body: As a team member, I would like to provide an intro video in the context of the roadmap so that interested parties can quickly understand the work the team is doing and the goals.

open.title: Create an epic progress widget for integration into the roadmap
open.body: As a community member or team member, I would like a concise, visually appealing representation of progress on DevEx epics within the context of the roadmap so that I can track how work is going.

open.title: Test P4P (In progress)
open.body: Testing the new assignment U.I.

open.title: Raise the P4P dollar value with OCG
open.body: As a government program owner I want to be able to issue P4P requests that are greater than $1K value because it takes significant effort to crate a P4P and evaluate the pull requests so I want to use my teams time as efficiently as possible.

open.title: Test DevEx user stories with internal group
open.body:
As a product manager I want to understand which of the DevEx roadmap user stories is the most engaging as I want to use this one to entice the user to read all the others.

Contact: Peter

DOD
1. Complete first iteration of the roadmap
2. Ask a group of internal people to read the all the roadmap stories
3. Observe behaviour
4. Ask which one was the most engaging
5. Provide feedback to Peter

open.title: Confirm artifacts of CC transaction
open.body:
As a product owner I need to confirm that the artifacts created during the CC transaction meet the necessary requirements to reimburse the project p-card so that we can amend the P4P guidelines.

Contact: Paul/Meaghan

DOD
1. Connect with the MTICs AP folks and present them with the issue 297 transaction artifacts
2. Confirm that the p-card can be reimbursed
3. Confirm that the p-card has been reimbursed

Next Task
1. Change the P4P guidelines

open.title: Roadmap widget
open.body: As a product owner I want to be able to show the product roadmap on a web page so that users can see (and understand) what new features will be introduced over the next twelve months.

open.title: Create DevEx marketing collateral for potential early adopters
open.body:
As an early adopter I need a visual that helps me understand the value that the DevExchange can bring to my service so that I can make a decision about how I can spend my time and budget.

Contact Peter

DOD
- Wireframe - at the epic level
- Check-in
- Composite
- Webpage

open.title: Create a product Road-Map webpage
Review of JIRA cloud legal terms
Update team list on the bottom of the devexchange page
DevEx Contact In-box
open.body: Need to redirect email traffic from Karen's inbox to Loren.

open.title: Sprint With Us ideation for simulation
open.body:
As a product owner I want to create a simulation design so that I can test the value and validity of a Sprint With Us model.

Contact: Peter/Paul

DOD
1. Explore at least 2 SWU workflows using the DevEx personas. 
2. Create a simulation design that emulates part or all of a SWU workflow.

open.title: PIA for MindMap
open.body: Create a PIA for Mindmup open source mind-mapping software so that the DevEx team can use it for  product roadmap planning

open.title: Sprint with us
open.body:
As a public sector program owner I should be able to field up to 50% of my sprint team (2-4 team members) from a team that is operating in the private sector, in a near-instant manner, and continue that engagement as long as it is needed so that I can quickly, and continuously, improve my program and its services.

As a small team of skilled individuals operating in the private sector I should be able to join a sprint team for a BC public sector program owner in a near-instant manner and be able to continue the engagement as long as it is needed so I can help them quickly and continuously improve their program and its services

open.title: As Wendy I want to sign up for a notification service so I don't miss pay 4 pulls
Plan an engagement for BCA API spec
open.body:
As a business owner I want to engage developers and tech entrepreneurs to comment on the proposed API spec so I can ensure it meets technical and business needs.

DOD
1) Decision to launch sandbox API.

open.title: Create Labs Terms of Use
open.body:
As a program owner and developer, I want to register and access keys for a sandbox API.  

DOD
1. Draft Terms of Use for API users (e.g. BCA & developer)
2. Draft Terms of Use for Labs partners (e.g. BCA & BCDevExchange)

open.title: Adding "work in progress"
open.body:
Related to timeboxing, showing work in progress on the Code with Us page. The in progress work might help the community avoid duplication of work and possibly self govern a timeboxing/reservation-type of approach.

DOD:

open.title: Explore legal and policy aspects of "Sprint with Us" option
open.body:
Linked to #279
DOD
Legal and policy requirements for option are are understood

open.title: Create an About Us page
open.body:
Create an About Us content page that describes what DevX is about - the initiative, the team, our principles and vision for the exchange. 

DOD:
- create About Us content
- create a page
- link page from the navigation menu

assigned to @lmullane  as per sprint 21 planning session.

open.title: Determine next steps from Transportation Discovery Day
open.body:
DOD

1. Receive survey results from WaveFront

2. Formal event debrief with survey results including Dev Ex team, WaveFront and Microsoft

3. Internal debrief to determine what the next transportation event looks like (i.e. Hackathon). Ensure that business outcomes are in alignment

open.title: P4P CEWT
open.body:
As a the CEWT program area, I want to post P4P issues so I can get help to complete work in my backlog.

DOD:
Post issues

open.title: Design - Labs Partner
open.body: Determine where and how the Labs Partner information/content will be integrated into the design

As a the BCDC program area, I want to post P4P issues so I can get help to complete work in my backlog.

DOD:

open.title: Code with Us page - link terms and p4p process
open.body: Add a link to the terms and p4p process on the code with us page to give developers this information before exploring opportunities in GitHub.

open.title: Differentiate between P4P and Community Contribution
open.body:
Revise "code with us" page content so that the community understands both p4p and "love" work/community collaboration is available.

DOD: 
- updated page content
- add the love/community work in the open/closed opportunities list if it exists.

open.title: Setup a lab environment with CI for BCDevExchange-app on OpenShift
open.body:
Requirements:
1. The end result should match http://uat.bcdevexchange.org, barring at most host name. Because the web app is comprised of source code on GH and instance-specific data such as database files, instance-specific config files, environment variables etc, this requirement implies a solution must be devised to merge source code with instance-specific data.
2. Implement a CI solution such that whenever a push is made to GH, the site is rebuilt automatically.
3. instance-specific data should be persisted across builds as build configuration, i.e. automated CI builds shouldn't require instance-specific data as input every time, nor deleting the data supplied earlier.
4. The build of web application should take place inside the container/image that runs the web application, not on the node that runs CI application, nor on the host.
5. The solution should be generic enough to able to apply to other web applications, at least on NodeJS platform.


This issue is related to #223, but #223 is one of the alternatives. S2I should be considered as well.

open.title: As a developer, I want different payment options so I can choose how I get paid for a Pay for Pull.
open.body:
As a developer, I want different payment options so I can choose how I get paid for a Pay for Pull.

DOD:
Confirm steps and approvals required to pay developers directly with a p-card
Confirm steps and approvals required for developers to receive direct payments

open.title: Use API client libraries in place of lower level code for API integrations.
open.body:
We are currently using "raw"/request based integrations for accessing GitHub and presumably other APIs. It would be preferable to use API providers' client libraries to reduce low-level code, and simplify implementation.  GitHub would be the obvious place to start.  There are several candidates listed here: https://developer.github.com/libraries/

#payforpullcandidate.

open.title: As a public sector dev user I need to know that Microsoft has become a DevEx lab partnership and I need to know what services are being provided
open.body:
The Microsoft partnership needs to be advertised/communicated so that the public sector devs come to the exchange, sign-up and explore the opportunities. 

Created by Peter

DOD
1. Comms plan

Connect with Peter

open.title: Safari OSX IOS requires fix
open.body: Can we fix Safari OSX IOS on opi.BCDevExchange.org

open.title: Integrating web analytics onto the profile page
open.body:
As a program owner I want to see usability metrics for my services within the exchange so that I can determine/measure business goals.

Created by: Peter/Paul

DOD
1. Create mini journeys to explain the value of the metrics.
2. Create a prototype
2. Test with users 

Approach
1. Review journeys with Peter/David H

Connect with
Daniel, Loren, Rommel

Revise "code with us" page content so that the community understands both p4p and "love" work/community collaboration is available.

DOD: 
- updated page content
- add the love/community work in the open/closed opportunities list if it exists.

data.title: Setup a lab environment with CI for BCDevExchange-app on OpenShift
data.body:
Requirements:
1. The end result should match http://uat.bcdevexchange.org, barring at most host name. Because the web app is comprised of source code on GH and instance-specific data such as database files, instance-specific config files, environment variables etc, this requirement implies a solution must be devised to merge source code with instance-specific data.
2. Implement a CI solution such that whenever a push is made to GH, the site is rebuilt automatically.
3. instance-specific data should be persisted across builds as build configuration, i.e. automated CI builds shouldn't require instance-specific data as input every time, nor deleting the data supplied earlier.
4. The build of web application should take place inside the container/image that runs the web application, not on the node that runs CI application, nor on the host.
5. The solution should be generic enough to able to apply to other web applications, at least on NodeJS platform.


This issue is related to #223, but #223 is one of the alternatives. S2I should be considered as well.

data.title: As a developer, I want different payment options so I can choose how I get paid for a Pay for Pull.
data.body:
As a developer, I want different payment options so I can choose how I get paid for a Pay for Pull.

DOD:
Confirm steps and approvals required to pay developers directly with a p-card
Confirm steps and approvals required for developers to receive direct payments

data.title: Use API client libraries in place of lower level code for API integrations.
data.body:
We are currently using "raw"/request based integrations for accessing GitHub and presumably other APIs. It would be preferable to use API providers' client libraries to reduce low-level code, and simplify implementation.  GitHub would be the obvious place to start.  There are several candidates listed here: https://developer.github.com/libraries/

#payforpullcandidate.

data.title: As a public sector dev user I need to know that Microsoft has become a DevEx lab partnership and I need to know what services are being provided
data.body:
The Microsoft partnership needs to be advertised/communicated so that the public sector devs come to the exchange, sign-up and explore the opportunities. 

Created by Peter

DOD

data.title: Integrating web analytics onto the profile page
data.body:
As a program owner I want to see usability metrics for my services within the exchange so that I can determine/measure business goals.

Created by: Peter/Paul

DOD
1. Create mini journeys to explain the value of the metrics.
2. Create a prototype
2. Test with users 

Approach
